title: Game accounts - Data analysis with ArrayList FRQ

content.description:
The  GameAccount  class is used to store information about players of an online game.  A partial declaration of the  GameAccount  class is shown.

public class GameAccount
{
 /**
 * Returns the username of the player
 */
 public String getUsername()
 { /* implementation not shown */ }

/**
 * Returns the age of the player
 */
 public int getAge()
 { /* implementation not shown */ }

/* There may be instance variables, constructors,
 and methods that are not shown. */
}

The  GamePlatform  class maintains an  ArrayList  of  GameAccount  objects named  allPlayers.  A partial declaration of the  GamePlatform  class is shown.

public class GamePlatform
{
 /** An ArrayList of all player accounts */
 public ArrayList<GameAccount> allPlayers;

/**
 * Returns the average age of players in allPlayers whose age 
 * is between 13 and 19, inclusive
 * Preconditions: allPlayers contains at least one player
 * whose age is between 13 and 19.
 * allPlayers is not null and contains no null 
 * elements.
 * Postcondition: allPlayers is unchanged. 
 */
 public double avgTeenAccounts()
 { /* to be implemented */ }

/* There may be instance variables, constructors,
 and methods that are not shown. */
}

Write the  GamePlatform  method  avgTeenAccounts.  The method should return the average age of the players in  allPlayers  whose age is between 13 and 19, inclusive.

For example, suppose  allPlayers  has the following contents:

The ArrayList has 6 elements.

Each element has 2 attributes:

Username

Age

The following presents each element’s contents from left to right, beginning with element 0.

The elements in the ArrayList have the following contents:

Element 0:

Username: "star_guy" 

Age: 23

Element 1:

Username: "a_knight" 

Age: 14

Element 2:

Username: "dino_dan" 

Age: 12

Element 3:

Username: "cool_cat" 

Age: 15

Element 4

Username: "happy_hero" 

Age: 13

Element 5:

Username: "fox_sox" 

Age: 19

For these contents of  allPlayers,  the method  avgTeenAccounts  should return  15.25.  There are four players whose age is between 13 and 19, inclusive ("a_knight",  "cool_cat",  "happy_hero",  and  "fox_sox").  The average age of these four players is <math alttext="open parentheses 14 plus 15 plus 13 plus 19 close parentheses divided by 4" is-custom-alt="false" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>14</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>15</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>13</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>19</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>/</mo> <mn>4</mn> </math>, which is 15.25.
content.question:
Complete method  avgTeenAccounts.
 /**
 * Returns the average age of players in allPlayers whose age 
 * is between 13 and 19, inclusive
 * Preconditions: allPlayers contains at least one player
 * whose age is between 13 and 19.
 * allPlayers is not null and contains no null 
 * elements.
 * Postcondition: allPlayers is unchanged. 
 */
public double avgTeenAccounts()

skill.text: 2.A: Write program code to implement an algorithm.
